name: Transatlantic Christian Council
memberOrga: TCC is a Stichting, based in the Netherlands. The regulations for such a legal body in the Netherlands are that a Stichting, which can be translated in the word 'foundation' is an organization without membership. Another possible concept for a legal body is an association. Associations have members. That doesn't mean that TCC does not represent many people. We contact them and can be contacted in several ways like, grass root meetings with the support base, national and international conferences in and out our office in personal meetings. In all this kind of meetings we get their views and can pass them on to the podia of the several official national and international bodies where TCC is working, including to the United nations, where TCC has accreditation with the UN Economic and Social Council. The current members of our Board are 3, Mr. Henk Jan van Schothorst is chair and executive officer and founder of the organization, from The Netherlands.
goal:
The mission of the Transatlantic Christian Council is to develop a transatlantic public policy network of European and North American Christians and conservatives in order to promote the civic good, as understood within the Judeo-Christian tradition on which our societies are largely based. Our goal is to influence public policy on both sides of the Atlantic from a Christian and politically conservative perspective, with the broad objective of fostering and protecting the greatest achievements of our political systems: limited government, the free market and individual liberty, especially religious freedom and freedom of education, with the family as the foundational building block of society.

By bringing together Christians and conservatives involved in policy think tanks, law, business, journalism, training and education, foundations and other institutions in the public square, the Transatlantic Christian Council will function as a transatlantic actor and hub for analyzing public policies and social trends, as well as promoting and facilitating reflection and action among a wide variety of like-minded people involved in public life.
interests: Borders and Security, Budget, Education and training, Enlargement, European Neighbourhood Policy, External Relations, Foreign affairs and security policy, Humanitarian aid and civil protection, Institutional affairs, International co-operation and development, Justice and Fundamental Rights
